description: Kotlin + Jetpack Compose 멀티 타이머 앱 MVP - 권한 0개, 오프라인, endAtEpoch 기반 시간 계산

userStories.title: Project Setup
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to set up the Android project with Compose and DataStore dependencies so that I can start building the timer app.

userStories.title: Domain Models
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to define the core data models so that the timer logic can be implemented.
acceptanceCriteria: TimerState enum (Idle, Running, Paused, Done) with @Serializable
All model classes compile without errors

userStories.title: Data Persistence Layer
userStories.description: As a user, I want my timers to persist across app restarts so that I don't lose my timer configurations.

userStories.title: Timer ViewModel with Epoch-Based Timing
userStories.description: As a user, I want my running timers to accurately reflect elapsed time even after app restart so that I can trust the timer accuracy.
acceptanceCriteria: pauseTimer() captures remaining from endAtEpoch - now
UI tick (500ms) refreshes display without state mutation
Timer reaching zero transitions to Done state

userStories.title: Theme and Base UI Components
userStories.description: As a user, I want the app to look good in both light and dark modes so that I can use it comfortably.
acceptanceCriteria: Material 3 Theme.kt with dark mode support
Components adapt to system dark mode

userStories.title: Timer Card Component
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see each timer as a card with name, color, and remaining time so that I can identify and monitor my timers.
acceptanceCriteria: TimerCard shows label, color indicator, remaining time (MM:SS)
Different visual states for Idle, Running, Paused, Done

userStories.title: Preset Chips Component
userStories.description: As a user, I want to quickly create timers using preset durations so that I can start timing with one tap.
acceptanceCriteria: Tapping chip creates timer with that duration
Created timer has default name and color

userStories.title: Add Timer Dialog
userStories.description: As a user, I want to create custom timers with name, color, and duration so that I can personalize my timers.

userStories.title: Home Screen Integration
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see all my timers on one screen so that I can manage multiple timers simultaneously.
acceptanceCriteria: HomeScreen with toolbar, preset chips, timer list, FAB
LazyColumn for timer cards with smooth scrolling
Empty state when no timers exist

userStories.title: Timer Actions and Edge Cases
userStories.description: As a user, I want timer actions to work reliably so that I can trust the app behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Timer completion while app backgrounded updates on resume

userStories.title: Final Polish and QA
userStories.description: As a user, I want a stable, crash-free app so that I can rely on it for timing tasks.
acceptanceCriteria: All 7 functional acceptance criteria pass (AC-1 to AC-7)
All 7 non-functional criteria pass (NF-1 to NF-7)
10 concurrent timers with no frame drops
Zero crashes in all tested paths
